Planisphere

This is a simple star chart that shows sun, moon and stars as well as constellations and planets.

Usage

The star chart shows the sky above the observer. The green circle is the horizon. Only objects within the green circle are visible in the sky. The center of the horizon circle is the zenith. The zenith is the imaginary point directly above the observer.
The cardinal directions seem to be swapped, because the star chart shows the view towards the sky above you. You can imagine laying on your back and looking upwards. When your feet are oriented to the south, on your right hand side is west and on your left hand side is east. When observing the sky, turn the device until the viewing direction is at the bottom of the screen.
The star chart can be zoomed in and out with two fingers. A single tap shows or hides the toolbar. Long press shows additional information of a selected celestial object.

Display Options

The menu item Display options allows you to enable or disable the elements of the chart:
  • horizon (with cardinal directions)
  • celestial equator
  • ecliptic
  • azimuthal grid
  • equatorial grid
  • constellation lines
  • constellation boundaries
  • constellation names (language can be changed in Settings)
  • solar system (sun, moon and planets)
  • solar system names (names of planets, etc)
  • stars
  • star names

Date and Time

The menu item Date / Time sets the date and time used to draw the star chart. The star chart is either continuously updated with the current time, or shows the sky for a specified fixed point in time. The time in this menu is always local time. The time zone is always the time zone of the operating system.

Maximum Magnitude

The menu item Max. magnitude sets a lower limit of brightness for objects displayed on the star chart. Objects darker than the maximum magnitude are not shown on the star chart. The value is the apparent magnitude for an observer on the earth (mag).
(0 mag: very bright; 8 mag: very dark)

Location

The menu item Location sets the location of the observer on earth. The location source is either a fixed location or GPS. When you choose fixed location, you have to enter latitude and longitude. North latitudes and east longitudes are positive.
When you choose GPS as the location source, the App tries to get the location from the operating system. Because this usually involves the usage of GPS or another navigation satellite system, a clear view to the sky is necessary. Of course you have to turn on location for the device and the app needs the permission to use the device's location. The Location dialog shows if the App received a location fix, the location latitude/longitude and the time of the fix. As long as the GPS status did not turn to received, the App uses the last known location.

Info Line

The info line is at the top of the display. The text shows information about the current star chart. As an example, the info line could show: 
2020-09-15  22:30 Europe/Amsterdam  20:30 UTC  51.31; 9.49 GPS: 1  Mag: 5
The meaning of the fields are:
2020-09-15 22:30
Date and time displayed in local time.
Europe/Amsterdam
The time zone used for the local time.
20:30 UTC
The time at the zero meridian in Greenwich.
51.31; 9.49
The location as latitude and longitude (north latitudes and east longitudes are positive).
GPS: 1
GPS: 1 means, the App received a GPS location fix from the device. GPS: 0 means, the App did not (yet) receive a location fix or a fixed location is used.
Mag: 5
Current setting of the maximum apparent magnitude (mag).

Object Details

Long press at a position on the chart shows a list of objects around this position. The list contains only objects visible on the chart and is ordered by distance from the long press position. Objects close to the position are at the top of the list. By selecting an object from the list, the App shows information about the object, for example rise and set times, phase and different coordinates.

Privacy

This App can access your location. The location is used to calculate the star chart. Location information is not collected or stored on your device and is not shared with anyone. Display options and settings are the only information stored locally on your device. No information does ever leave your device. This app does not connect to the Internet at all.
